oversell.translation[0].definitions[0].d: to praise someone or something too much
oversell.translation[0].definitions[0].e: Tourism on the island is oversold.
oversell.translation[0].definitions[1].d: to sell more of something than is actually available
oversell.translation[1].definitions[0].d: to say that something you are selling is better, more useful etc than it really is
oversell.translation[1].definitions[0].e: Vendors tend to oversell the software. That gives people more confidence to work with it than they should have.
oversell.translation[1].definitions[1].d: to sell more of something than is available
oversell.translation[1].definitions[1].e: They regularly oversold seats on their flights.
